<div class="content-section">
  <h2>Who is the Course For?</h2>
  <p>This course is intended for healthcare supply chain researchers, practitioners, and students who want to model uncertainty in logistical systems using <strong>Markov Chains</strong>. It assumes familiarity with basic probability and matrix manipulation in R.</p>
</div>

<div class="content-section">
  <h2>Learning Objectives</h2>
  <div class="objectives-grid">
    <div class="objective-card">
      <div class="icon"><i class="fas fa-project-diagram"></i></div>
      <p>Understand the structure and assumptions of <strong>discrete-time Markov chains (DTMCs)</strong></p>
    </div>
    <div class="objective-card">
      <div class="icon"><i class="fas fa-calculator"></i></div>
      <p>Apply transition matrices to <strong>simulate system evolution</strong> over time</p>
    </div>
    <div class="objective-card">
      <div class="icon"><i class="fas fa-infinity"></i></div>
      <p>Compute and interpret <strong>steady-state distributions</strong></p>
    </div>
    <div class="objective-card">
      <div class="icon"><i class="fas fa-pills"></i></div>
      <p>Model <strong>brand switching and service reliability</strong> in healthcare supply chains</p>
    </div>
    <div class="objective-card">
      <div class="icon"><i class="fab fa-r-project"></i></div>
      <p><strong>Simulate and visualize</strong> long-run outcomes in R</p>
    </div>
    <div class="objective-card">
      <div class="icon"><i class="fas fa-lightbulb"></i></div>
      <p>Link model insights to supply chain <strong>policy decisions</strong></p>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="content-section">
  <h2>Prerequisites</h2>
  <ul class="prereq-list">
    <li>Comfortable with <strong>basic probability</strong> (random variables, distributions)</li>
    <li>Familiarity with <strong>R and tidyverse</strong> for matrix operations and plotting</li>
    <li>No prior knowledge of Markov chains is assumed</li>
  </ul>
</div>

<div class="content-section">
  <h2>Course Topics</h2>
  <ul class="topics-list">
    <li>
        <h4>Section 1: Foundations of Markov Chains</h4>
        <ul>
            <li>State-based systems and probabilistic transitions</li>
            <li>The Markov property and memoryless dynamics</li>
            <li>Transition probability matrices and system trajectories</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>
        <h4>Section 2: Steady-State Analysis</h4>
        <ul>
            <li>n-step transitions and convergence</li>
            <li>Existence and uniqueness of steady-state distributions</li>
            <li>Interpreting long-run behaviour in real systems</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>
        <h4>Section 3: Brand Switching Case Study</h4>
        <ul>
            <li>Promote-local strategy for paracetamol brands</li>
            <li>Simulate switching behaviour and market share convergence</li>
            <li>Solve steady-state equations using R</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li>
        <h4>Section 4: Applied Simulation in R</h4>
        <ul>
            <li>Vector-matrix calculations</li>
            <li>Transition matrix exponentiation</li>
            <li>Plotting and comparing convergence paths</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
  </ul>
</div>
